result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Detroye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Joint & Several. Due during term of probation. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

-Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Inform agent of prescriptions.
-Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
-Defendant to submit to random testing.
-Submit to DNA sample.
-No contact with Travis Diels, Mitchell Hundt, Mark Wollenzien.
-Pay Supervision Fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joseph M. Detroye in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of atty form filed. Court examines defendant and accepts said waiver. Court enters not guilty plea on defendant's behalf.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
